article.title: Generalized Grounding Graphs: A Probabilistic Framework for Understanding Grounded Commands

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows four robotic domains studied in the paper. Which of these domains specifically involves mobile manipulation commands focused on physical directives like "Pick up the pallet on the truck"?

This figure illustrates the grounding graph for the phrase "Put the pallet on the truck." Which component of the grounding graph represents the potential physical objects in the environment that could correspond to the noun phrase "the truck"?

This figure compares the parse tree and induced models for two different commands. What is the primary difference between the graphical models for the commands "Put the pallet on the truck" and "Go to the pallet on the truck"?
choices: The factorization of the linguistic structure
The type of probabilistic predicates used

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows a sequence of actions a forklift takes in response to the command "Put the tire pallet on the truck."  What does the grounding for γ3 represent in this sequence?
choices: The action of picking up the pallet
The location on the truck where the pallet should be placed

multiple_choice_question.text: This equation represents the factored form of the probability distribution over groundings given the language and the environment model. What does the symbol φm represent in this equation?
